questions.question: Refractive index of the material increases when temperature

explanations.a: In most materials, as temperature increases, density decreases, hence refractive index typically decreases.
explanations.b: Correct: Generally, refractive index increases as temperature decreases due to increased density.
explanations.c: Refractive index does depend on temperature in most materials.
explanations.d: Rarely observed behavior in specific materials, not general case.

answers.a: Light must travel from denser medium to rarer medium
answers.b: Angle of incidence should be greater that of critical angle
answers.c: Light must travel from rarer medium to denser medium

explanations.a: Correct: Total internal reflection occurs only when light moves from denser to rarer medium.
explanations.b: Correct: The angle of incidence must exceed the critical angle.
explanations.c: Incorrect: TIR cannot happen when moving to a denser medium.
explanations.d: Correct Answer: Both conditions are necessary for total internal reflection.
